main event: A round, moon-sized object was observed in the sky over Englewood, Ohio on November 20, 1961.
interesting points: The object was described as appearing and disappearing erratically.
The object was initially thought to be the Moon and a bright star, but the witness later determined this was not the case.
The witness reported the object was a reddish-orange color and brighter than the brightest stars.
The witness stated the object was not of this world in appearance.
The witness reported seeing the object on multiple occasions in August and September 1961.
photographs: yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
